meanings.definition: A sampling or collection of opinions or votes from a group of people.
meanings.sent1: The teacher conducted polls to find out which book the students liked best.
meanings.sent2: The polls showed that most people preferred chocolate ice cream over vanilla.
meanings.sent3: The polls revealed that the majority of students wanted longer recess.
meanings.sent4: Her polls on social media garnered a lot of attention and responses.
meanings.sent5: The polls indicated a clear winner in the competition.

meanings.definition: The place where votes are cast in an election.
meanings.sent1: The school gymnasium served as the polls for the local election.
meanings.sent2: Citizens lined up early at the polls to exercise their right to vote.
meanings.sent3: The polls were bustling with activity on election day.
meanings.sent4: Candidates often visit the polls to greet voters and ask for support.
meanings.sent5: The polls closed promptly at 8 p.m. as scheduled.
